pli-tv-kd11:1.1.2: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-kd11:1.1.3: At that time the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka were quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha. They went to other monks who were also quarrelsome, argumentative, and creators of legal issues in the Sangha, and said to them,

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.2: “How can the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka act like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:1.2.11: “Is it true, monks, that the monks Paṇḍuka and Lohitaka are acting like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.1: At that time Venerable Seyyasaka was ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, and lacking in boundaries.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.2: And he was constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.3: In addition, the monks regularly gave him probation, sent him back to the beginning, gave him trial periods, and rehabilitated him.

pli-tv-kd11:9.1.9: Soon afterwards the Buddha had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
pli-tv-kd11:9.1.10: “Is it true, monks, that the monk Seyyasaka goes on like this?”

pli-tv-kd11:10.1.98.1: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of demotion done against himself should conduct himself properly.

pli-tv-kd11:13.1.1: At one time the bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka were staying at Kīṭāgiri.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.2: They were misbehaving in many ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.3: They planted flowering trees, watered and plucked them, and then tied the flowers together. They made the flowers into garlands, garlands with stalks on one side and garlands with stalks on both sides. They made flower arrangements, wreaths, ornaments for the head, ornaments for the ears, and ornaments for the chest. And they had others do the same.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.4: They then took these things, or sent them, to the women, the daughters, the girls, the daughters-in-law, and the female slaves of respectable families.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.5: They ate from the same plates as these women and drank from the same vessels. They sat on the same seats as them, and they lay down on the same beds, on the same sheets, under the same covers, both on the same sheets and under the same covers. They ate at the wrong time, drank alcohol, and wore garlands, perfumes, and cosmetics. They danced, sang, played instruments, and performed.
pli-tv-kd11:13.1.6: While the women were dancing, singing, playing instruments, and performing, so would they.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.1: They played various games: eight-row checkers, ten-row checkers, imaginary checkers, hopscotch, pick-up-sticks, dice, tip-cat, painting with the hand, ball games, leaf flutes, toy plows, somersaults, toy windmills, toy measures, toy carriages, toy bows, letter guessing, thought guessing, mimicking deformities.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.2: They trained in elephant riding, in horsemanship, in carriage riding, in archery, in swordsmanship.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.3: And they ran in front of elephants, in front of horses, and in front of carriages, and they ran backward and forward.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.4: They whistled, clapped their hands, wrestled, and boxed.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.5: They spread their outer robe on a stage and said to the dancing girls,
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.7: and they made gestures of approval.
pli-tv-kd11:13.2.8: And they misbehaved in a variety of ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.1: Just then a monk who had completed the rains residence in Kāsī was on his way to visit the Buddha at Sāvatthī when he arrived at Kīṭāgiri.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.2: In the morning he robed up, took his bowl and robe, and entered Kīṭāgiri to collect almsfood. He was pleasing in his conduct: in going out and coming back, in looking ahead and looking aside, in bending and stretching his arms. His eyes were lowered, and he was perfect in deportment.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.3: When people saw him, they said,
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.4: “Who’s this, acting like a moron and always frowning?
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.5: Who’s gonna give almsfood to him?
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.6: Almsfood should be given to our Venerables Assaji and Punabbasuka, for they’re gentle, congenial, pleasant to speak with, greeting one with a smile, welcoming, friendly, open, the first to speak.”
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.8: A certain lay follower saw that monk walking for alms in Kīṭāgiri.
pli-tv-kd11:13.3.9: He approached him, bowed, and said,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.1: He took that monk to his house and gave him a meal.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.2: He then said, “Where are you going, Venerable?”
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.3: “I’m going to Sāvatthī to see the Buddha.”
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.4: “Well then, would you please pay respect at the feet of the Buddha in my name and say,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.5: ‘Venerable Sir, the monastery at Kīṭāgiri has been corrupted.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.6: The bad and shameless monks Assaji and Punabbasuka are staying there.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.7: And they’re misbehaving in many ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.8: They plant flowering trees, water them …
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.21: And they misbehave in a variety of ways.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.22: Those who previously had faith and confidence have now lost it,
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.23: and there’s no longer any support for the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.24: The good monks have left and the bad monks are staying on.
pli-tv-kd11:13.4.25: Sir, please send monks to stay at the monastery in Kīṭāgiri.’”
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.1: The monk consented, got up, and set out for Sāvatthī.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.2: When he eventually arrived, he went to the Buddha in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery. He bowed to the Buddha and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.3: Since it is the custom for Buddhas to greet newly arrived monks,
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.5: “I hope you are keeping well, monk, I hope you’re getting by.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.6: I hope you’re not tired from traveling.
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.7: And where have you come from?”
pli-tv-kd11:13.5.8: “I’m keeping well, Venerable Sir, I’m getting by.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.0: 3.1 The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.1: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.2: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.4: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.5: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.6: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.7: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.0: 3.2 The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.18.1: “When a legal procedure of banishment has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.19: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.21: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.22: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.23: When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.24: “When a procedure of banishment has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.0: 3.3 The group of fourteen on wishing
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.35.1: “When a monk has three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of banishing him:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.36: he’s quarrelsome, argumentative, and a creator of legal issues in the Sangha;
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.37: he’s ignorant and incompetent, often committing offenses, lacking in boundaries;
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.38: he’s constantly and improperly socializing with householders.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.40: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.41: he has failed in the higher morality; he has failed in conduct; he has failed in view.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.43: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.44: he disparages the Buddha; he disparages the Teaching; he disparages the Sangha.
pli-tv-kd11:14.1.46: “When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.49: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:14.1.55: When a monk has another three qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of banishing him:

pli-tv-kd11:16.1.1: Soon afterwards a sangha of monks, headed by Sāriputta and Moggallāna, went to Kīṭāgiri and did the legal procedure of banishing the monks Assaji and Punabbasuka,

pli-tv-kd11:18.1.1: At one time Venerable Sudhamma was the staying at the householder Citta’s monastery at Macchikāsaṇḍa. He was in charge of the building work and received a regular supply of food.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.2: Whenever Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he would not do so without getting permission from Sudhamma.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.3: On one occasion a number of senior monks—Venerable Sāriputta, Venerable Mahāmoggallāna, Venerable Mahākaccāna, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhika, Venerable Mahākappina, Venerable Mahācunda, Venerable Anuruddha, Venerable Revata, Venerable Upāli, Venerable Ānanda, Venerable Rāhula—were wandering in Kāsī, when they arrived at Macchikāsaṇḍa.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.4: When Citta heard that they had arrived,
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.5: he went to them, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.6: After Sāriputta had instructed, inspired, and gladdened Citta with a teaching,
pli-tv-kd11:18.1.8: “Venerables, please accept a meal for visitors from me tomorrow.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.1: When he knew that they had accepted, Citta got up from his seat, bowed down, circumambulated them with his right side toward them, and went to Sudhamma. He bowed to him
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.3: “Venerable, please accept tomorrow’s meal from me together with the senior monks.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.5: “Previously when Citta wanted to invite the Sangha, a group of monks, or an individual monk, he wouldn’t do so without getting my permission.
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.7: He’s been corrupted, this Citta. He’s uninterested and has no affection for me.” He said to Citta,
pli-tv-kd11:18.2.14: “What difference does it make to me whether Sudhamma accepts or not?” He then bowed, circumambulated Sudhamma with his right side toward him, and left.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.1: The following morning Citta prepared various kinds of fine food for the senior monks.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.3: “Why don’t I go and see what Citta has prepared for the senior monks?” He then robed up, took his bowl and robe, and went to Citta’s house, where he sat down on the prepared seat.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.4: Citta approached Sudhamma, bowed, and sat down.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.6: “You have prepared many kinds of food.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.7: But there’s one that’s missing: sesame cookies.”
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.8: “When there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, Sir, you speak of sesame cookies.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.9: In the past there were some traders from the south who went to an eastern country to trade.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.10: From there they brought back a hen.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.11: That hen mated with a crow
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.12: and because of that she had a chick.
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.13: When that chick wanted to caw like a crow, it cried, ‘caw-ca-doodle-doo.’
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.14: And when that chick wanted to crow like a rooster, it cried, ‘cock-a-doodle-caw.’
pli-tv-kd11:18.3.15: In the same way, when there are so many jewels in the word of the Buddha, you speak of sesame cookies.”

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.0: 4.1 The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.1: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.2: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done without the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.4: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.5: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.6: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done without having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.7: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done in the absence of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.8: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without questioning the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.9: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without the admission of the accused, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.10: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t committed any offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.11: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that isn’t clearable by confession, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.12: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s confessed their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.13: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having accused the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.14: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.15: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also illegitimate, contrary to the Monastic Law, and improperly disposed of: it’s done without having charged the person with their offense, it’s done illegitimately, it’s done by an incomplete assembly.”
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.17: The group of twelve on illegitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.0: 4.2 The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.18.1: “When a legal procedure of reconciliation has three qualities, it’s legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.19: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done with the admission of the accused.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.21: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of:
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.22: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.23: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after having accused the person of their offense, it’s done after having reminded the person of their offense, it’s done after having charged the person with their offense.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.24: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done in the presence of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.25: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the questioning of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.26: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done with the admission of the accused, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.27: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.28: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who’s committed an offense that’s clearable by confession, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.29: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done against one who hasn’t confessed their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.30: “When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after accusing the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.
pli-tv-kd11:19.1.31: When a procedure of reconciliation has another three qualities, it’s also legitimate, in accordance with the Monastic Law, and properly disposed of: it’s done after reminding the person of their offense, it’s done legitimately, it’s done by a unanimous assembly.

pli-tv-kd11:19.1.34: The group of twelve on legitimate legal procedures of reconciliation is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.0: 4.3 The group of four on wishing
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.1: “When a monk has five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a legal procedure of reconciliation against him:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.2: he’s trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; he’s trying to harm householders; he’s trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; he abuses and reviles householders; he causes division between householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.4: When a monk has another five qualities, the Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against him:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.5: he disparages the Buddha to householders; he disparages the Teaching to householders; he disparages the Sangha to householders; he demeans and insults householders; he doesn’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.7: “The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against five kinds of monks:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.8: those who are trying to stop householders from acquiring material gain; those who are trying to harm householders; those who are trying to get householders to lose their place of residence; those who abuse and revile householders; those who cause division between householders.
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.10: The Sangha may, if it wishes, do a procedure of reconciliation against another five kinds of monks:
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.11: those who disparage the Buddha to householders; those who disparage the Teaching to householders; those who disparage the Sangha to householders; those who demean and insult householders; those who don’t fulfill legitimate promises to householders.”
pli-tv-kd11:20.1.13: The group of four on wishing is finished.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.1: “A monk who’s had a legal procedure of reconciliation done against himself should conduct himself properly.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.3: He shouldn’t give the full ordination.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.5: He shouldn’t have a novice monk attend on him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.6: He shouldn’t accept being appointed as an instructor of the nuns.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.7: Even if appointed, he shouldn’t instruct the nuns.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.8: He shouldn’t commit the same offense as the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.9: He shouldn’t commit an offense similar to the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.10: He shouldn’t commit an offense worse than the offense for which the Sangha did the procedure of reconciliation against him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.12: He shouldn’t criticize those who did the procedure.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.13: He shouldn’t cancel the observance-day ceremony of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.14: He shouldn’t cancel the invitation ceremony of a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.15: He shouldn’t direct a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.16: He shouldn’t give instructions to a regular monk.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.17: He shouldn’t get permission from a regular monk to correct him.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.18: He shouldn’t accuse a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.19: He shouldn’t remind a regular monk of an offense.
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.20: He shouldn’t associate inappropriately with other monks.”
pli-tv-kd11:21.1.21: The eighteen kinds of conduct in regard to the legal procedure of reconciliation are finished.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.6: If he forgives, all is well.

pli-tv-kd11:22.3.9: If he forgives, all is well.
